name: A. Remainder
statement:
You are given a huge decimal number consisting of n digits. It is
guaranteed that this number has no leading zeros. Each digit of this
number is either or .You may perform several (possibly zero) operations
with this number. During each operation you are allowed to change any
digit of your number; you may change to or to . It is possible that
after some operation you can obtain a number with leading zeroes, but it
does not matter for this problem.You are also given two integers 0
le y < x < n. Your task is to calculate the minimum number of operations
you should perform to obtain the number that has remainder 10^y modulo
10^x. In other words, the obtained number should have remainder 10^y
when divided by 10^x.
